predefined_profiles.name: Zhou Weiguo
predefined_profiles.public profile: Zhou Weiguo is a member of a civilian guerrilla organization, living in a small town rich in coal mines. The town has a train station and warehouses, which attracted significant attention shortly after the war began. The enemy did not hesitate to pay a heavy price to occupy this small town. To conceal his identity, Zhou Weiguo works at the mine. Since he knows how to drive, he became a driver responsible for transporting coal to the train station, living a relatively easy life.
predefined_profiles.goal: Conduct effective covert operations in the enemy-occupied zone, complete the mission of destroying the gas bombs the enemy plans to transport to the front lines, and survive successfully.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Zhou Weiguo aims to make a significant contribution in the Anti-Japanese War to advance his military rank.

predefined_profiles.name: Old Wang
predefined_profiles.public profile: Old Wang is a friend Zhou Weiguo met at the mine. He is a minor manager there and helped Zhou Weiguo get the driver’s job. However, he is a traitor who sells out his compatriots.
predefined_profiles.goal: Betray his compatriots to earn rewards.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Old Wang wants to save enough money working under the enemy to escape with his family and stay away from the war.

scenario: The time is one year after the start of the Anti-Japanese War. In the enemy-occupied area, the guerrilla team, after blowing up the tracks connecting the mine to the train station, suffered severe losses due to the enemy's crackdown. Consequently, Zhou Weiguo's team decided to halt operations. To avoid detection by traitors, they severed contact. Zhou Weiguo is hiding at the mine alone, where he discovers gas bombs the enemy is preparing to send to the front lines. As a member of the guerrilla team, Zhou Weiguo must make the right choice to intercept the train carrying the bombs and destroy them.

profile.name: Da Zhuang
profile.public profile: Da Zhuang is a confidant of Zhou Weiguo and runs a noodle stand while also being a guerrilla member secretly stationed in the mining area.
profile.private profile: Da Zhuang's youngest son was brutally killed by the invaders, and Da Zhuang is determined to avenge his son.
profile.goal: To destroy the gas bombs the enemies are transporting by train to the warfront.

dialog.content: It's a year after the beginning of the War of Resistance. The guerrillas in the occupied areas had destroyed the railway connecting the enemy's mine to the station. After severe losses due to enemy purges, Zhou Weiguo's team decided to pause operations, cutting off contact to avoid being discovered by traitors. Zhou Weiguo, while undercover in the mine, discovered the enemies' plan to transport gas bombs to the frontline. As a guerrilla member, it's up to Zhou Weiguo to make the right choice and try to intercept the train to destroy the gas bombs.
(After finishing a day's work at the mine) Lao Wang, to thank you for helping me get a driver's job, let me treat you to dinner at the nearby noodle stand. Don't turn up your nose at it.
(Smiling and courteously) Oh, please, don't mention it. It was nothing.
(The two chat and laugh on their way and soon arrive at the noodle stand) Boss! Two bowls of your best noodles. His noodles have flavor; I come here often.
(Seeing it's Zhou, Da Zhuang starts complaining) Ah, look at these invaders, there’s no evil they haven’t done. They’ve eaten here for free countless times!

(Zhou quickly gives Da Zhuang a look, it's a sensitive time and careless talk is dangerous. Lao Wang doesn’t react to Da Zhuang’s words) Zhou, I just remembered there's something I need to deal with at the mine. Let's have noodles another time; I have to go.

(Watching Lao Wang leave, he recalls hearing from his fellow miners that Lao Wang is a traitor who got his minor manager position by providing intel on the guerrillas. Slightly puzzled) Huh, why the sudden matter?
Zhou, did I say something I shouldn't have? I shouldn’t have let my mouth run, should I? He seemed like an official—did I upset him? What should we do, Zhou?

content.content: No, not at all. Listen to me, just don't worry about it. Old Wang's just like that; sometimes he remembers things suddenly and has to handle them immediately. You'll get used to it. Let's get our noodles; I love your noodles.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his cleverness in explaining the situation to Da Zhuang with good expressive ability?

content.content: (Rolling his eyes in the direction Lao Wang left) Da Zhuang, he's just like that, I'm at a loss too. Let's just ignore him.
(Sarcastically) Well then, that bureaucrat sure acts like he's got power. If he doesn’t want to eat, he just leaves. Having a position really is something.
(Apologizing quickly) Da Zhuang, Da Zhuang, I really didn’t know Lao Wang was like this. I’m sorry, let me help you with the dishes.

(Remembering that Lao Wang mentioned it was finally quiet in the mines, all problems resolved) There's something too odd about this sudden matter, Da Zhuang. I'll go see if I can help. Sorry, I'll visit another time.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo show detail in remembering his conversation with Lao Wang, exhibiting detail management skills?

content.content: (Angrily shouting) That darn Lao Wang! I can’t believe he left just as the noodles were ready. I’ll never invite him again; if I do, I’m a fool.
(Secretly pleased) Nice, I saved some money. Da Zhuang, if you haven't made them yet, don’t prepare the other bowl. No one's going to eat it. Keep it for next time when I come alone.
(Guilt-ridden, apologizing quickly) Sorry, Da Zhuang, you had everything almost ready. Lao Wang had to leave. Please don't take it personally; it's just the way Lao Wang handles things sometimes.

dialog.content: (Dazhuang listens to Zhou Weiguo's explanation and feels a bit relieved) Oh, so that's it. I get it, I get it. As long as I haven't offended anyone. The noodles are here, let's eat.

(Suddenly, there are gunshots outside at night, possibly the guerrillas have been discovered. Zhou Weiguo grabs his gun and heads towards the sound of gunfire, finding Dazhuang being chased by the enemy; the situation is urgent) What? It's Dazhuang!

profile.name: Li Ming
profile.public profile: Li Ming is one of the younger members in the guerrilla team, full of youthful vigor, clever and quick, but tends to act on his own.
profile.private profile: Li Ming wants to actively demonstrate his capabilities in the guerrilla team and has thoughts of heading to the front lines to fight the enemy.
profile.goal: Destroy the enemy's gas bombs being transported to the war front by train.

dialog.content: (Just as Zhou Weiguo finishes speaking, Li Ming covers his mouth from behind and says) Friendly forces, friendly forces! Don't make a sound if you don't want to be exposed, the enemy is both in front and behind us. What do you plan to do?

content.content: (Li Ming releases his hand) How can I stand by while my compatriot is in distress? It’s perfect to use the cover of night to shoot—shouldn’t be discovered. He’s my friend, I have to save him!

question: #question# What can Zhou Weiguo do to demonstrate his willingness to save his compatriot Dazhuang and show his sense of social responsibility in times of danger?

content.content: (In shock) Never mind Dazhuang, who are you? Why did you suddenly appear here? I haven’t seen you before.
Oh my gosh, so many enemies! I can't handle them. It's better to stand aside in this situation, or else I might accidentally hurt myself.
Sorry, Dazhuang, I can't save you either. I have to run first, or I won't survive either.

(Zhou Weiguo is about to break free from Li Ming's grip to shoot and save Dazhuang. Realizing it's enemy-occupied territory, he restrains his impulse as there are too many enemies around.) I can't help, Dazhuang, sorry.

question: #question# How does Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his ability to control his impulses and avoid acting rashly by not shooting?

content.content: (Breaking free from Li Ming's grip and glaring intensely) How can I watch my fellow countrymen get attacked and do nothing? I should just wipe out these enemies.
(Immediately shoots and gives Li Ming a push) Young man, run quickly. Be careful not to get noticed. Dazhuang, run! I'm coming to save you.
What can I do, do you think? Should I go help? But without orders from my superiors, I can't act recklessly.

dialog.content: But there are so many enemies, you can't handle this alone. I didn't bring a gun, so I'm out of here.
(Zhou Weiguo doesn't have time to deal with the young man, dismisses him quickly, and calls out urgently) Da Zhuang! Watch out!
(Zhou Weiguo quickly empties his magazine at the enemies in the alley, several enemies fall with screams) Old Zhou? Don't worry about me, just run!
(The remaining enemies start shooting back) Stop talking, run!
There are too many enemies around here, we can't defeat them all. Just the two of us can't manage this, I'm out of bullets.

Just as Da Zhuang finishes speaking, the way in front and behind them gets blocked. It turns out Old Wang went to report their location. The enemies, preferring to kill by mistake than let them escape, launch a barrage of gunfire. Da Zhuang and Zhou Weiguo are both killed.
Alas, there's nothing we can do. Hurry back now. There are too many enemies; don't get spotted. I'm off.

(Watching Li Ming disappear into the night, Zhou Weiguo quickly turns to head back. But as luck would have it, he rounds a corner and bumps into Old Wang along with a few soldiers) Hey, Old Wang, just wandering around this late at night, huh?
Zhou Weiguo, out so late? Didn't you hear the gunshots? Aren't you scared?
(Stammering) Uh, well, I suddenly got a fever and went out to grab some medicine. Isn't it because I heard the shots and got scared, so I'm hurrying back?
(Gesturing for the soldiers to seize Zhou Weiguo) Is that so? Grab him and search him.

Before Zhou Weiguo could react, he was subdued by the soldiers, and a gun was found on him. Cursing, Zhou Weiguo shouted a few words at Old Wang, who happily instructed the soldiers to escort him to the gendarmerie to await further action from the enemy. In the end, Zhou Weiguo was unfortunately captured.

(Dazhuang is also afraid of saying something wrong and causing trouble, feels reassured with Old Zhou following to check out the situation) Alright, alright, if something comes up, just hurry and deal with it!

(Zhou Weiguo follows Old Wang to the Garrison Office at the enemy's train station, doesn't know what Old Wang said to the enemy, but he left bowing and scraping) What's Old Wang doing here? He's really a traitor!

profile.name: Li Ming
profile.public profile: Li Ming is one of the younger members of the guerrilla team, full of youthful vigor, cunning and quick, but tends to act on his own.
profile.private profile: Li Ming wants to prove himself in the guerrilla team, desiring to head to the front lines to resist the enemy.
profile.goal: To destroy the chemical bombs the enemy is sending to the war front by train.

dialog.content: (Jumps out from nowhere, giving Zhou Weiguo a scare) Are you following that Chinese guy who was talking to the enemy?
(Frightened and quickly covers the other person's mouth) Shush, can you keep it down? Do you want me to get spotted? But who are you? Friend or foe?
(Li Ming simply introduces himself) Alright, I know who you are too. I've heard about you in the team.
Time is tight so I won't ask more. You look young, just don't hold me up, follow and let's check it out together.
(Old Wang stealthily follows Dazhuang who is packing up and going home) Do you know the person he's following? He's about to leave, what are you planning to do? Will you help?

content.content: He seems a bit dangerous, but we better not meddle. Rushing in could easily expose us, and I'm not sure of his identity. I'll just go home and sleep.

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his ability to think independently and make decisions in the face of a friend's dangerous situation?

content.content: Gosh, just a few bad words about the enemy from Dazhuang got Old Wang onto him. What should I do; will I be the next to be reported by Old Wang? I'm so scared.
(Rolls up sleeves) Young man, is there even a question about it? Coming to the aid of others is a traditional virtue in our nation; I won't just sit back and do nothing.
(Helpless and angry) Sigh, I never thought Old Wang would actually be that type of person. In this situation, I can only be angry but can't speak out.
(Zhou Weiguo is extremely angry inside, but the situation is too delicate, so he forces himself to stay calm) Don't get mad, stay calm! We can't blow our cover. You go ahead, I'll handle him.

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo effectively control his anger towards Old Wang's traitorous actions?

content.content: (Bursts out in anger on the spot) How could anyone tolerate this? Old Wang! You traitor, what are you doing here?
(Immediately chickened out) Old Wang's with the enemy; I better get out of here and hide quickly, or I might be next.
(Shocked but delighted in secret) Ah! Old Wang has cozied up with the enemy; looks like I better start cozying up to Old Wang for some benefits.

dialog.content: (with a look of compassion) Alright then, it's getting late, so I'll head back. Until we meet again.
(after saying goodbye, on his way home, suddenly hears the sound of gunshots) Dazhuang is probably in grave danger, it's terrifying.

profile.name: Zhang San
profile.public profile: Zhang San is Zhou Weiguo's mining friend. He is honest and straightforward, generally has a good relationship with Zhou, and despises the invaders but feels powerless.
profile.goal: To work diligently at the mine to support his entire family.

dialog.content: (The next day, Zhou Weiguo continues to work at the mine and inadvertently discovers that the invaders are loading gas bombs onto the truck, but since he hasn't contacted other guerrilla members, he dares not act rashly. He returns to the mine to find his fellow miners outside) Why haven't any of you gone down the mine?

The demand for coal from the invaders is increasing, and current production can't meet the demand. The higher-ups have decided to blast the mine to expand the mining area. The explosives are already planted and will be detonated soon. By the way, if you have any personal items left, you'd better go get them quickly.
Oh, I actually do have quite a few things; I might need to make several trips.
I'll go with you then. Since the explosives are set, there's not much time left, so we shouldn't delay.

(The two head to the mine to get their things, but Zhou Weiguo's mind is still on the gas bombs) So this is where the explosives are planted; I haven't seen it yet. Should we mess with the invaders a little, haha.
(realizing something's off) Old Zhou, what do you mean? Are you thinking about stealing some explosives to slack off at work? Are you really going to take some?

content.content: (reflecting on hearing the gunshots outside last night without being prepared) I still think it's better to be safe than sorry. Perhaps taking some explosives could come in handy. Let's take some.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo's actions demonstrate that he learned from his last experience?

content.content: (wishing to slap himself) Zhang San, you must think I'm crazy. I can't even manage my own stuff and still want to take some explosives.
(cautiously) Forget it, I better not take them. If I go out with explosives and the other miners see me, that would be the end.
Zhang San, you're really joking, huh. There's so much explosive here; if only I could take it all, I wouldn't have to work anymore.
(thinking that stealing explosives wouldn't be helpful and could get him in trouble) Old Zhang, you're really joking. I haven't even organized my own stuff yet; I'd better sort my things first.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo show his strong goal regulation skills?

content.content: Oh my, Old Zhang, would you dare take any of these? I wouldn't dare. These explosives are too dangerous; I'm scared of an accidental discharge.
(really wants to give himself a slap) I must be out of my mind. What good would taking a little explosive do? And yet, I still think about stealing some. I'm truly insane.
But taking just a little might not make a big difference. If I'm really going to steal, maybe I should steal more explosives and leave my stuff behind.

dialog.content: What? Lao Zhou, you really want to take it?

(Forgetting Zhang San was next to him, he quickly deceives Lao Zhang to evade suspicion and takes a few while Zhang San isn't looking) No way, just kidding with you, Lao Zhang. Hold tight, let's head back quickly.
(With a loud bang, the explosives in the mine were detonated) Ah, let's go, more work has just arrived.

(After loading up the car, Zhou Weiguo hides the bomb under the coal in the car, takes his home-made box cannon and all the bullets, then drives to the train station where two Japanese soldiers are chatting) Just in time, I can light the explosives and rush in; neither of them can stop me.

Zhou Weiguo secretly ignites the explosives, and before the Japanese soldiers could react, he hurriedly runs into the freight carriage. With a loud explosion, the gas bomb of the Japanese was ignited. The gas released by the explosion spread far and wide, covering half of the city, causing countless civilian casualties. Zhou Weiguo did not survive.
Haha, I'm just joking with you. Let's hurry up and pack so we can leave quickly.
(After packing up everything) I had quite a lot of stuff, it wore me out. Thanks, Old Zhang.
(With a loud boom, the explosives in the mine were detonated) Well, looks like it's going to get even more tiring.

(Old Wang comes to check the mine situation, and as the smoke clears, the mine doesn't look right) What's going on? The mine has collapsed! This will definitely affect coal production, and the Japanese won't let us off easy.
(Feeling a bit regretful) What? The explosives were too powerful, they've collapsed the entire thing. If they blew up the Japanese instead, they could have taken out even more of them.

(Old Wang, both scared and angry, yells at everyone to clear out the collapsed mine. Even before the excavation is complete, there is new notice from the Japanese) Everyone, keep going! The Japanese demand the mine's output to be doubled, so no one is allowed to leave from now on. You’ll eat, drink, sleep all at the mine, sixteen hours a day. The Japanese will guard to make sure no one slacks off.

Under such intense work conditions, the food was nothing more than slop. Gradually, some couldn't hold on, but it was no use, as the Japanese didn't care about the miners' lives, only wanting increased output. In such dire circumstances, Zhou Weiguo had neither the ability to resist nor endure, ultimately dying from exhaustion in the mine.
(Completely lost) You're just going up there like that? Well, I'm out; I don't want to get involved.
(Quickly stepping forward to stop Lao Wang) Lao Wang, what do you mean by following the noodle stand owner?

(Smiling awkwardly, acting sneaky) Lao Zhou, just one tip-off about guerrilla members and there's money to be made. I heard Da Zhuang bad-mouthing the devils, so I thought I'd let the devils investigate him. Haha, do you want in? If you do, I can let you have this opportunity—there's real money to be had!
Huh? What? Really?
Would I lie to you? Lao Zhou, think about whether you want to join in?

content.content: (With no orders, Zhou Weiguo has to decide independently to eliminate a threat for the guerrilla team) Lao Wang, you're a traitor right in front of me. Do you think I would still join you? I'll kill you right here.

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his capacity for independence?

content.content: (Mind goes blank) You asked so suddenly, what should I do? I'll go home and ask my family later.
(Panicking) There's a traitor right in front of me, but I haven't contacted any other guerrilla members, so I can't act rashly!
Oh my God, Lao Wang, you're in cahoots with the devils, aren't you? You're really a traitor. I can keep your secret; I'll pretend I didn't see anything.
(Thinking it’s better to infiltrate to understand their schemes) Lao Wang, is there really money to be made? Count me in. What should I do?

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo's response to Lao Wang demonstrate his decision to pretend to join him and take risks?

content.content: (Hesitant and unsure, thinking he’ll report back to his leaders later) This is so sudden; I can’t decide. Let me go home and ask my parents.
(Hearing about the money, Zhou Weiguo makes a decision without hesitation) Who doesn't want money? Lao Wang, count me in right now!
(Face turns red upon hearing this, throws a punch at Lao Wang) Lao Wang! You damn traitor, go to hell for selling out the country!

dialog.content: What? What did you say? I didn't hear you clearly. Are you going to kill me?
(Immediately steps forward and puts Old Wang in a chokehold) Yes, you heard right, now die!
(Face turns red) You...
(After dealing with Old Wang's body, Zhou Weiguo hurriedly went home. The next morning, Zhou Weiguo acted as if nothing had happened when he arrived at the mine) Morning, everyone.
Old Zhou, there's a new manager again, did you know? I heard he's not a good person either, and today I’m being sent to the train station to load coal onto the train. Gotta go now.
Alright, off you go. We might run into each other soon. It's almost winter, and the Japs need a lot of coal. I've also been notified to send some to the train.
(After working in the morning, they indeed met at the train station) You're here, Old Zhou. This is so tiring; it's rushed and still better to work at the mine.
Really, what's loaded on this train?

(Lowers voice) It's a major project for the Japanese. One cargo carriage is loaded with supplies, another with guards, so you can't get close. The other six are for coal, and we can enter them. There are many called in to help load them, and it's expected to be finished and dispatched by noon.

(After Zhang San was called away to work, Zhou Weiguo turned and saw the cargo carriage door was open, he quietly boarded to check) This carriage is full of boxes. Hey, why's there only one uniform left in this box? Oh no, this one contains shells and gas masks, these shells are gas bombs! Damn Japs, all ruthless stuff!
(Just as Zhou Weiguo finished speaking, someone covered his mouth from behind) Shh, don't make a sound, I'm a friend!
(The person lets go and signals for silence) Huh? You again, what are you doing here?

My name is Li Ming, I'm also a member of the guerilla force. We've been notified that the Japanese are transporting gas bombs to the front line. We're planning to blow up their transport train, but since I'm too young, they wouldn't let me join, so I acted on my own and snuck onto this train.
What? You dared to act on your own? You really are too young. Do you know how dangerous this is?
I know my limits. Great, I've got an extra pair of hands now. Quick, get a uniform from one of these boxes to wear. Let's disguise and hide on the train, waiting for our chance.
(Unable to convince him, Zhou Weiguo hurriedly put on a Japanese uniform) Fine, we'll hide among these goods. Whatever happens, don't act on your own; follow my lead.
Got it, you're so naggy!

(After a couple of hours, the Japs boarded the train. Luckily, the supplies hid them well enough not to be noticed. An hour after the train departed, a Japanese soldier suddenly moved towards the supplies, and gunfire broke out outside the carriage) Is it your unit taking action?
It should be. We've been traveling for so long; we must have reached the place. If it's my unit, what should we do next?

content.content: Li Ming, we've been squatting on this train for too long, and we're out of energy. Rushing to fight the Japs won't give us much chance of winning, so let's save up some energy and search the supply boxes for any usable weapons.

question: #question#How should Zhou Weiguo tell Li Ming they need to seize the chance to regulate their energy to better deal with the Japs?

content.content: (Cheering) Li Ming, great, your unit is here. Then I guess we won't be needed. Let's just rest here.
(Quickly hiding further into the carriage) This is all just random shooting. There's no chance we won't get hit. I'm a bit scared.
Let's go, Li Ming. Since your unit is here, we'll coordinate with them from inside and fight the Japs to the death!
Li Ming, there are six Japs. The two of us sneaking in is easily noticed, and escaping is hard too. So I'll go in, and you stay here. Otherwise, we won't get anything done or help our pals outside.

question: #question#How should Zhou Weiguo persuade Li Ming to continue waiting in the supply box?

content.content: (Sternly) Li Ming, listen up. From the beginning, we agreed you’d take my orders. This is an order; you can't argue, only obey.
If you disagree and want to sneak in too, I won't stop you. If you go, I won't.
(Frowns angrily) Li Ming, I'm willing to stay here with you, but could you stop causing trouble? Without you, I'd have succeeded long ago.

dialog.content: (Feeling a bit hungry too) Okay, it would be best if we had guns and explosives, and some food would be good too.

(The sound of their rummaging caught the attention of the Japanese soldiers, a few of them started to come check the supply boxes) We've been discovered, I think. Follow my lead, I'll go out now and divert them; you quickly jump out the window from the back.
(Without waiting for Li Ming's response, Zhou Weiguo headed into the middle of the carriage) Alright, I'll avenge you.

The Japanese soldiers saw Zhou Weiguo in military uniform and looked at each other in confusion. They brought him in front of their officer and noticed the extra person as well as Zhou Weiguo's discarded clothes. Immediately realizing what was happening, they shot Zhou Weiguo without hesitation.
I think it makes sense. Alright, you go ahead. I'll hide.

(As soon as he went out near the supplies, an enemy soldier got shot in the head. Zhou Weiguo quickly pretended to check the injuries while searching the body) Li Ming, there's a grenade and an enemy ID.
(in a low voice) That's quite handy. What are you planning to do next?

content.content: Then I’ll just keep blending in! With this enemy ID, our situation is much better. I'll go check if there’s anything else useful.

question: #question# How does Zhou Weiguo's response to Li Ming show his optimism about their situation?

content.content: (laughing heavily) If this is the enemy’s level, we can definitely take out a lot of them!
I better get back and discuss with you again, let’s plan some more.
Taking out an enemy so easily, it seems like they’re not all that tough. We should have a good haul this time!
We should act together. We only have a chance of success if we work together. Staying with the enemy is too dangerous, I’ll better go back and hide.

question: #question# What can Zhou Weiguo do to show his focus on cooperating with Li Ming to achieve their goals?

content.content: Li Ming, you're just a kid, you know nothing. I don't even count on you.
Sigh, all alone out here, I have no idea what to do.
Oh my god, it’s so dangerous, I’m scared I might get accidentally killed.

dialog.content: Alright, let's see who we can take down next, drag this dead one over, and I'll pretend to be him.

(The two continue to mix in, the sounds of the battle quickly cease, the guerrillas couldn't take the train, suddenly a Japanese soldier said something, all the Japanese start checking each other, it seems they've discovered an extra person) Damn it, they seem to have found out.
(The Japanese officer said something, and all the soldiers start lining up) Oh man, old Zhou, they're about to find out, what are we going to do?

content.content: A small grenade might not blow up the entire carriage, staying alive is more important. Now the only way to survive is to use my grenade to threaten them. Everyone, stay back!

question: #question#What can Zhou Weiguo do to demonstrate his excellent decision-making skills?

content.content: Li Ming, this is really the end. Haven't they just identified me? I'd rather die instantly than face severe torture.
(In a panicked state, pulls the grenade pin) Li Ming, get out of the way, I'm going to fight these Japs to the death! Argh, you all die!
Hahaha, Li Ming, looks like we're going to heroically sacrifice ourselves on this train. Are you ready to take the Japs down with us?
Since it's come to this, I'll just have to fight to complete the mission. Otherwise, who knows when I'll get another chance? Li Ming, seize the moment and jump off the train!

question: #question#What can Zhou Weiguo do to show that he persists in completing the task of destroying the Japanese munitions, even at the last moment?

content.content: (Fearful) Li Ming, I’m so scared. Maybe we can still make it if we surrender to the Japanese. I really don’t want to die.
Maybe I should try to threaten these Japs. Maybe they're afraid to act rashly, and we might still manage to survive.
I truly regret it, if I’d known it was going to be like this I wouldn't have come. What mission? I just want to stay alive.

dialog.content: Alright, there’s nothing else we can do now.
(Zhou Weiguo pulls out a grenade and removes the pin. The enemy soldiers hesitate to shoot, knowing there are munitions on the truck.) Everyone fall back! Li Ming, jump!

Li Ming opened the car door and jumped decisively, followed by Zhou Weiguo, who threw the grenade. Since the grenade landed far from the supplies, it didn’t ignite the munitions. Fortunately, Zhou Weiguo and Li Ming managed to jump out in time and survived, although the mission failed.
What! This is too dangerous, Zhou Weiguo!

(Zhou Weiguo pulls out a grenade and runs towards the supply box. The enemy reacts and begins shooting. Zhou Weiguo, enduring excruciating pain, pulls the pin on the grenade and throws it.) Run! Aaaah, go to hell, all of you...
Amid the shouts of the enemy, Zhou Weiguo lost consciousness. He successfully detonated the gas bomb on the train. The mission was a success, but Zhou Weiguo did not survive.
Indeed, when brothers work together, they can cut through metal!
(After a short while, the sounds of battle quickly subsided.) It's over, it seems the guerrillas weren't able to capture the train.
(The train continues to move forward.) Ah, what do we do now? They couldn't take it down, do you think we should detonate the grenades ourselves?

content.content: Our own survival is certainly important, but contributing to our fellow citizens is even greater; let's detonate now and go down with them.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his determination and perseverance in completing the task?

content.content: (Suddenly silent) But I don't want to die yet; my goal is to stay alive.
(Turning to Li Ming) If you want to die, go die by yourself. I still want to live a few more years.
(A bit agitated) We can try again if the mission fails this time, but if we die, there's no coming back.
I know you want to detonate now, but even if we do, we can't escape. Let's wait until we get to the station and go big—there might still be a chance to live. Trust me, let's hold on a bit longer.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo convince Li Ming to follow his instruction to wait until the station to detonate the grenades?

content.content: (Shocked) Huh? Is that what you really think, Li Ming? Alright, then let's do it your way, I suppose the outcome won't differ much in the end.
(Looking at Li Ming) But if you think this way and I think that way, we're not on the same page, so I can't make a decision.
Li Ming, do you dare to take a big gamble? Since we can't agree, let's leave it to fate and draw lots.

dialog.content: (with determination) Alright, I’m willing!
(pulling the pin from the grenade, taps it and throws it into the box filled with shells) Good brother!
In the next life, I hope we are brothers again!
(smiles) Alright! Five, four, three, two, one...
With the thunderous boom of the shells, the entire cargo hold was demolished. The mission was accomplished, but both Zhou Weiguo and Li Ming sacrificed their lives.
(Feeling a surge of admiration for Zhou Weiguo, thinking what he said makes a lot of sense) Alright! I'll do as you say.
(Exhaling deeply) Well, the guerrilla's failure was expected, after all, they were outnumbered and outgunned.
Sigh, now it's up to the two of us, let's hope we make the right gamble.
(The train stops at the station, just as Zhou Weiguo picks up his grenade to prepare it for detonation) Li Ming, look outside, a few trucks have arrived to load up supplies.
And a few soldiers have come to load the goods, oh my, more of them are coming, what should we do?

content.content: Since they're already here, why not see where they take the supplies? We can blow it up later if needed. I'm already used to this disguise. Let's go, let's mix into their territory for a bit.

question: #question#What actions by Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his strong adaptability and seamless integration among the enemy?

content.content: (Flustered) Oh my gosh, I'm getting a bit scared seeing so many soldiers. Aren't you scared at your age?
(Looking at Li Ming with some doubt) Li Ming, even though we're dressed like this, isn't it just like covering one's ears and not hearing anything?
But we only have one enemy pass. If they check us again, we're finished, so you go by yourself, Li Ming, I'm scared.
Looks like there's no time left. If we stay longer, we'll be exposed. Put on the gas masks now! We're about to detonate, and leave the rest to fate.
I really don't know if we should detonate or not, it's so tough now, I feel like I'm struggling in a den of wolves.
I really regret this, didn't realize the enemy was so strong, I shouldn't have come. Should've escaped on the train.
There's no time, we can't detonate, or we won't have time to escape.

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his ability to manage timing effectively?

content.content: (Seeing this, Zhou Weiguo is dumbfounded) It's over, the enemy is so strong, we definitely can't escape.
(Extremely excited) Li Ming, come quickly and look at the tanks, it's my first time seeing so many tanks, they're so cool.
(Hesitating) What should we do with so much stuff, I don't know where to start.

dialog.content: (Immediately understands what Zhou Weiguo means) Okay.

(The two blend in with the crowd; just as they are about to finish moving the gas shell crates, a soldier opens the crate missing two uniforms) It's over, Li Ming, cover your nose and run! I'm going to blow up the truck.
No! We do it together!
(The soldiers are already starting to check amongst themselves) Hurry, we don’t have time, they’ve already found out. That’s an order.

Amidst the chaos, Li Ming quickly runs away. Zhou Weiguo pulls out a grenade, removes the safety pin, and charges into the truck. With a loud explosion, the truck blows up in succession, turning the sky yellow. The mission to destroy the gas shells is a success, and Zhou Weiguo sacrifices himself.
(Zhou Weiguo immediately pulled the pin of the grenade, knocked it against something, and tossed it inside, turning to run) That was so intense!
Hahaha, we've really been through life and death together.
After four or five seconds, a massive explosion occurred, destroying the train. Amidst the thick yellow smoke, the two of them slipped away wearing gas masks.
(with a cautious look) Why would I lie to you? There's definitely a reward! Just report Da Zhuang's location to the enemy's military police.
(thinking to himself, they've really sold Da Zhuang out) It's that simple? I won't lose my head over this, right?
That's right, no need to worry. As long as the information is accurate, you'll get the money, guaranteed safety!
(a bit hesitant, also fearing that Da Zhuang might actually be killed) I'm still a bit scared. Are the enemy really that kind-hearted?
(anxiously) I've spelled it all out for you, Old Zhou. What are you still hesitating and thinking about?

content.content: (thinking to himself, if I've decided to pretend to join, I must see it through) Alright, I've made up my mind. I'll report to the enemy's military police right away, aiming for a big achievement.

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his commitment to the task of pretending to be a traitor, highlighting consistency?

content.content: (half doubting, still uncertain) Really, Old Wang? I know you wouldn't lie to me, but I'm really a bit worried about the reliability of this.
(scared and backing off) Sorry, Old Wang, I just can't bring myself to overcome this fear. You go instead, I'm too scared.
(revealing the truth, no longer pretending) Old Wang, aren't you curious why I suddenly showed up here? Didn't expect it, did you? I was testing you, and turns out you're really a traitor.

(thinking to himself, even if undercover, I can't sacrifice my fellow countrymen, protecting them is my duty, he plans to secretly warn Da Zhuang) Alright, Old Wang, you wait here, I'm going right away!

question: #question#How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his sense of responsibility in protecting his fellow countrymen in times of crisis?

content.content: (impatient to make money, starts to run) Old Wang, I'm heading out now, make sure you stay here and don't let him run off, I'm off to report.
(blinded by money) I can't do anything either, in such times of crisis, what could be more important than earning money to survive?
(after careful consideration) Old Wang is alone, winning the trust of the enemy this way is worth it, so I can carry out my tasks from here on effectively.

dialog.content: Of course, there's no need to hesitate. Why would I harm you? Go quickly.

(Zhou Weiguo reported Dazhuang's location to the enemy troops, and went with a group of them to capture Dazhuang. He and Old Wang waited at the entrance. After successfully capturing Dazhuang, Zhou Weiguo was just about to return when a gunshot rang out) Ah, Old Wang? You tricked me...

Old Wang felt that Zhou Weiguo was getting too close to Dazhuang. He pretended to ally with Zhou Weiguo but was actually planning to capture both of them in one fell swoop. Zhou Weiguo fell into the trap and was killed, leading to the mission's failure.
(Zhou Weiguo sneaks around to the back of Dazhuang's house and knocks on his window) Who's there?
(Zhou Weiguo quickly explains the situation to Dazhuang) You need to leave now!
Alright! I'll meet you at the tea stand on the city wall tomorrow morning. I need your help with something.
Okay, I have to go now, time is critical.

(Zhou Weiguo brings soldiers to search Dazhuang's house. The soldiers are angrily speaking to Old Wang, who then turns to question Zhou Weiguo) What's going on? Why are you so slow? Dazhuang has already escaped. I won't count on you next time. I'm leaving!

profile.name: Wu Ming
profile.public profile: Wu Ming is a collaborator with the invaders, working under Old Wang, cowardly and avaricious.
profile.goal: To survive at any cost during the war period.

dialog.content: (Zhou Weiguo heads home and meets a figure in an alley. He assumes it's a passerby and ignores him) Hey! Dazhuang is looking for you.
(perplexed) Hmm? Are you talking to me? Who are you?
I said Dazhuang is looking for you? Aren't you going?

content.content: (The person emphasizes again, making Zhou Weiguo tense up immediately, fearing a trap. Zhou Weiguo tries to appear calm and unpressured) Who? Dazhuang? Where is Dazhuang?

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo respond to demonstrate his ability to manage stress in this questioning by Wu Ming and make an appropriate response?

content.content: (suddenly breaks down and screams) Who are you, and why are you saying such random things? Don't ask me; I know nothing.
(pretends not to respond, acting deaf and dumb) Huh? What are you saying? I can't hear you. Can't hear a thing you're saying!
(pretends to suddenly hear someone calling him from another direction) Hold on a second, someone seems to be calling me. I have something to attend to, we'll chat later.

(Zhou Weiguo still wants to adhere to his agreement with Dazhuang) But I’m supposed to meet Dazhuang at the tea stand tomorrow morning. Is there something urgent happening this late? Otherwise, I’ll stick to our agreement and go in the morning.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his commitment to following the agreement with Dazhuang and acting according to instructions?

content.content: (shocked and anxious) What? Did you say Dazhuang needs me now? Is there something very urgent? Hurry and take me there!
(pauses in doubt and gives a brief response, acting casual as he walks away) Oh, I got it, but I have things to do, we'll talk about whatever later.
(looking puzzled) Who are you anyway, why do you keep asking me? Do I even know you to believe what you’re telling me?

dialog.content: I'll wait for you in the small courtyard next to the tailor on the west side of the city.
Huh? That's all you're going to say, nothing about what it's about?
No, I don't know either. I've got to go now.
Hey, don't go, is this really all the information?
Yeah, that's all. Now it's up to you to decide what to do.

content.content: (Zhou Weiguo thoughtfully considers how strange this all is. Without finding Da Zhuang, he runs into someone claiming Da Zhuang wants to meet him. It's likely a trap set by Old Wang.) Alright, I got it, you can go. I have other things to do; I'll check out the place you mentioned later.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his ability to analyze a situation where he suddenly encounters a mysterious person and effectively handle it by making use of new information to make a judgment?

content.content: I'm going nuts. You just say that and then leave? I know nothing, you didn't make anything clear, and I have no idea what I should be doing.
(utterly confused) Alright, fine, so you guys just pass messages like this, huh? All chaotic and confusing... I'll just act like I didn't understand and go back for a nice sleep.
(rolls eyes) Is this some prank you and Da Zhuang plan on pulling tonight? If that's the case, forget it, I don't have time for him.
(Zhou Weiguo doesn't think much more of it, figuring it might be confidential) Since you came to find me, there must be something important. I trust you, so I'll go check out that place.

question: #question# How can Zhou Weiguo demonstrate his ability to trust others?

content.content: Wow, you scared me. I thought it was something major. Sending someone like you to pass a message without saying anything means it probably isn't important.
(mentally bewildered) Seriously, who on earth are you? I don't even know you, and yet you just name a place—why should I listen to you?
(cautiously thinking) Could this person be sent by Old Wang to test me? I should go tell Old Wang someone approached me on the road.

dialog.content: Why don't you go directly? Fine, I've delivered the message, I'm off.
(Zhou Weiguo heads to the gendarmerie and tells Old Wang about what just happened and the address he got) Hmm, you don't need to worry about it anymore. Go back and rest early.
(cursing inwardly, realizing this was a test) Alright, you should rest early too, I'm heading back.

(Early the next morning, Zhou Weiguo goes to the location Da Zhuang mentioned and hastily tells him about the previous day's events) Oh my, thank you so much. You saved my life last night. I really am a member of the guerrilla forces.
(After the confirmation, Zhou Weiguo also reveals his identity, lowers his voice and becomes cautious) Yes, me too. Is there anything I can help with?

At noon today, a train loaded with coal is heading to the main battlefield the invaders are attacking. Although the train is mostly filled with coal, our informant reports that one cargo car is loaded with a large number of gas bombs. If successfully transported, it will greatly aid the invaders' attack. We've organized about ten people to hijack the train during its journey, and ideally, blow up these gas bombs. However, the enemy will assign personnel to escort the train, generally numbering around 40-50 people, so hijacking the train with just a few of us is impossible. But we still want to try, so we came to seek your help. We're not asking you to hijack the train, but could you perhaps reduce the number of escort personnel?
This is quite a grand undertaking you have here, and indeed, it's a bit challenging.
(shakes his head helplessly) There's nothing we can do; it's the mission. Think carefully, do you have any ideas?

content.content: I have an idea. I'll trick Old Wang into thinking the guerrilla forces are attacking the mine today. As long as the enemy believes it, the numbers will dwindle significantly. With winter approaching, the mine is crucial. My relationship with Old Wang is quite good, even if there's an issue, at most we'll have a spat. He probably won't do anything to me. I'm quite confident about our relationship.

question: #question#How does Zhou Weiguo demonstrate confidence in his relationship with Old Wang?

content.content: Da Zhuang, it's not that I don't want to help you, but I must be upfront; I'm not entirely sure Old Wang will believe what I say because our relationship is just so-so, not particularly strong.

(frowning) Da Zhuang, you know, I've heard Old Wang is quite the two-faced snake. You might think your relationship with him is good, but he might not see it that way. In fact, he might not even consider you a friend.
Da Zhuang, I've suddenly thought of a very effective method because Old Wang is a greedy person. If you get me some money, as long as we have cash, Old Wang's side will be easy to deal with.

(with a troubled expression) Da Zhuang, after listening to you, listen to me. You know as well as we do that the odds in this fight are just too great against us, so someone has to sacrifice. Let me do it.
Da Zhuang, this is all too troublesome and prone to errors. Why don't I just go and destroy the train with them? I'll strap explosives all over myself and detonate it directly on the train.

(shocked, feeling incredible) Da Zhuang, what do you mean by this? Are you really planning to go head-to-head with the enemy when the gap in strength is so vast yet still going bravely forward? In that case, count me in. We'll face them head-on.

question: #question#How does Zhou Weiguo show he collaborates on Da Zhuang's task but also keeps his survival in mind?

content.content: (a bit frightened, wanting to back out) Da Zhuang, are you guys really not afraid? This is the enemy's territory. While it's easier for me to help you, do I really have to? I'm honestly a bit scared inside.

(interrupting Da Zhuang who wants to continue speaking) Da Zhuang, you consider me a brother, right? I don't have to think this much for things like this at all. For fighting the Japanese, I'm in. Let's just get on with it.
(lacking confidence) Da Zhuang, what I'm more worried about now is that Old Wang won't believe what I say. I'll just go to the mine and start the operation, while you guys move quickly.

dialog.content: Alright, I think what you said makes sense. Just make sure you stay safe.

(Zhou Weiguo hurriedly runs back to the mine to find Old Wang, saying he heard a rumor on the street that the guerrillas are planning to attack the mine today.) You've really improved, kid. I'll quickly go inform the Japanese. When the time comes, you'll be credited with a great achievement.

(Sure enough, after a little while, quite a few Japanese soldiers arrived at the mine, but they instructed that no one was to leave the site, fearing that adding more troops might get noticed. A day passed without the mine being attacked. Old Wang, along with the Japanese, angrily came looking for Zhou Weiguo) Old Zhou, what happened? The intelligence was false, and this has severe consequences. The train the Japanese were using for transport was blown up, and they're very angry. This has very serious consequences.

A Japanese soldier stands behind Old Wang, angrily pointing a gun at Zhou Weiguo. Just as Old Wang finishes speaking, a gunshot rings out. The Japanese soldier shoots Zhou Weiguo, successfully completing the mission to destroy the gas bombs, but Zhou Weiguo was sacrificed.
Alright, that's a good idea. Hope the devils believe it. You take care too.

(Zhou Weiguo arrives at the mine and finds Old Wang, saying he heard a rumor about the guerrillas planning to attack the station today) I see. Better to believe it than dismiss it. I'll quickly go tell the devils, this might be a great accomplishment. You don’t have to work today, go hide near the station early, and see if there are other undercover agents here. Let me know tonight if you find any.

(Zhou Weiguo rushes to the station, and indeed there are more devils than usual. Knowing it's best not to stay, he quickly packs up, buys a ticket, and leaves) Bye, Old Wang! Hope you're prepared for what's coming your way. I'm off!

On his escape route, Zhou Weiguo overhears someone talking about how a few days ago, the guerrillas blew up a train carrying coal belonging to the devils. Mission accomplished, Zhou Weiguo escapes and looks for other guerrilla groups.
Alright, I'm really leaving now, goodbye!
(Zhou Weiguo arrives at the location mentioned by the person, but there's no sign of Dazhuang) Huh? No one's here, how strange.
(Just after speaking, Old Wang appears with a few soldiers) Old Zhou, it turns out you really are in cahoots with Dazhuang. Looks like you need to be investigated too.
(Suddenly realizing) Old Wang, you actually suspect me, you traitorous scum! Pah!
(As he speaks, the soldiers move forward to tie up Zhou Weiguo and take him back to the military police station) There's nothing I can do, take care of yourself.

Zhou Weiguo was taken back to the enemy's military police station and subjected to severe torture, but he steadfastly refused to provide any information, even hurling contemptuous insults at the soldiers. In the end, he succumbed to the harsh treatment and sacrificed his life.
(Just as Zhou Weiguo finished speaking, Old Wang appeared from the side with a few people) Old Zhou, I knew you would tip off Da Zhuang.
(With a cold laugh) Old Wang, you're quite clever, no wonder you're a 'traitor'!
A few people surrounded Zhou Weiguo and took him to the enemy's military police station, where severe torture awaited him. Zhou Weiguo was captured, and the mission failed.
